title: Tracking issue for hoedown -> pulldown regressions

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: A-docs
labels.description: Area: documentation for any part of the project, including the compiler, standard library, and tools

body:
In https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/40338, we landed pulldown-cmark. 🎊 But, given that it's a different renderer, there are bound to be differences. [This comment](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/40338#issuecomment-290057507) pointed out some obvious problems. These bugs are going to be much easier to clean up than the initial PR was to land, though 👍 To help with this work, I generated docs for both the commit before and the commit of, ran all the HTML files through [tidy-html5](https://github.com/htacg/tidy-html5/), and put it up here: https://github.com/steveklabnik/docdiff/commit/ddda1fe51588755874bbfd331ecb134e79922596 the `'` -> `"` changes are expected, but that tool doesn't have the ability to re-write those, so I left them in for now, which, frankly, makes the diff kinda large. working on it. Here's the stuff we've found so far: - [x] horizontal rules - [x] footnotes (waiting for pulldown update https://github.com/google/pulldown-cmark/pull/21) - [x] images - [x] `
` for `HardBreak`s - [x] the title part of links being rendered as visible text rather than as an attribute on the `` tag (imperio update: I'll need an example to be able to fix this one) - [x] `MarkdownHtml` now doing the same as `Markdown` when it should be escaping raw HTML. - [x] [some strange rendering](https://github.com/steveklabnik/docdiff/commit/ddda1fe51588755874bbfd331ecb134e79922596#diff-73ae1ced9c2ca5ba756a60f7b63b3e9dL785) around methods at times? rendered: https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/std/collections/struct.LinkedList.html#method.front_place source https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/src/libcollections/linked_list.rs#L700 fix: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/41066 - [x] In src/libstd/collections/hash/map.rs under "Relevant papers/articles:", it appears the ordered list has been rendered as an unordered list instead. PR r+'d - [x] `^` now needs to be an html ``. (this is not a regression in the code, but something that needs to be adapted in the docs) https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/41043 - [x] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/40918 (this one was due to markdown spec switch) - [x] Footnotes should have a link back to their referent, see https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/40919#discussion_r109126016 - [x] words getting smooshed together (I think the hard/soft break fixed this, I'm not observing it now) - [x] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/40978 (this one was due to markdown spec switch) This change will land in tonight (3/29)'s nightly, so we can also poke at them then. I plan on making a users post tomorrow to advertise this bug. Tagging as a regression so we make sure to take care of it. Marking as `P-high` and assigning @GuillaumeGomez and @frewsxcv who are both already working at knocking some of this out.
